DOC.brief_summary: The study will include 10 adult patients with cystic fibrosis. The aim of the study is to evaluate whether Tobramycin 300 mg aerosol once-a-day for 28 days can reduce the bacterial load in the airways. Secondary end-point is the evaluation of variation in bacterial susceptibility during and at the end of study period.
DOC.brief_title: Tobramycin 300 mg Once-a-day (o.d.) Aerosol in Adults With Cystic Fibrosis
DOC.detailed_description: Ten adult patients with cystic fibrosis will be enrolled in a stable phase and will received prophylaxis with aerosol of Tobramycin 300 mg once a day for 28 days.
DOC.criteria: Outpatients, male and female, age range 1845 years Diagnosis of cystic fibrosis FEV1 >50% predicted. sputum samples available Chest x ray negative for pneumonia and tuberculosis Informed consent Allergy to tobramycin Use of systemic steroids in the previous 2 weeks Pregnancy or breast feeding Treatment with other experimental drug in the previous 3 months
